author: Aryabhatta
author_info: Aryabhata was an ancient Indian mathematician and astronomer who lived around the 5th century CE. He is one of the most significant figures in the history of Indian mathematics and astronomy. His work, the "Aryabhatiyam," is a foundational text in these fields.

author: Aryabhatta
author_info: Aryabhata was an ancient Indian mathematician and astronomer who lived around the 5th century CE. He is one of the most significant figures in the history of Indian mathematics and astronomy. His work, the "Aryabhatiyam," is a foundational text in these fields.
summary: "Aryabhatiyabhasya" is a Commentary on the "Aryabhatiya," an ancient Indian mathematical and astronomical text written by Aryabhata, an influential Indian mathematician and astronomer. The "Aryabhatiya" itself is a foundational work in Indian astronomy and mathematics.
toc: Aryabhata's 'Aryabhatiya' is a comprehensive mathematical and astronomical treatise that comprises a rich tapestry of mathematical principles, astronomical insights, and computational methods. The work commences with salutations to the divine and the author's introduction, wherein Aryabhata introduces the revolutionary decimal place- value system and the concept of zero, pivotal in shaping the future of mathematics. The text systematically elucidates arithmetic operations, including addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division, offering practical methods for problem-solving. In the realm of astronomy, Aryabhata presents his groundbreaking heliocentric model of the solar system and addresses planetary motion, planetary positions, and eclipses. Throughout the work, discussions on timekeeping, calendar systems, and trigonometric concepts, such as sine and versine functions, further showcase the author's multifaceted genius. The 'Aryabhatiya' stands as a testament to Aryabhata's pioneering spirit, originality, and enduring contributions to mathematics and astronomy, laying the groundwork for future generations of scholars.
